title.narrative: WASH ENABLING ENVIRONMENT

description.narrative: The Government and partners have strengthened capacities to develop, implement and monitor coordinated, evidence-based policies, strategies and plans for equitable, gender-responsive and sustainable access to basic Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene (WASH) services., which contributes to Evaluation, Research, Safe And Equitable Water, Sanitation And Hygiene Services And Practices, Safe And Equitable Water, Sanitation And Hygiene Services And Practices (Covid), Water, Sanitation And Hygiene Systems And Empowerment Of Communities. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Data, Research, Evaluation And Knowledge Management, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Harnessing Power Of Business And Markets, Partnerships And Engagement: Public And Private, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2023, more children, adolescents and women, particularly the most vulnerable, benefit from improved and equitable neonatal, child, maternal and adolescent health and nutrition services, and adopt healthy life practices.

related-activity.ref: 3420/A0/06/001 CHILDREN AND ADOLESCENTS SURVIVE AND THRIVE

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: The Government and partners have strengthened capacities to develop, implement and monitor coordinated, evidence-based policies,strategies and plans for equitable, gender-responsive and sustainable access to basic WASH services.

description.narrative: UNICEF national advocacy;with public/private partners was crucial to scale-up the uptake of Philippine Approach to Sustainable Sanitation (PhATSS).;Since the launch of the Philippines National Handwashing;Campaign,;it has leveraged both public and private resources to raise;awareness and influence;individual hygiene;behaviours;to stop;the spread of preventable diseases.;Emergency response continued;to impact an effective and;consistent implementation of workplan.;UNICEF contributed to drafting and reviewing the Philippine Water Supply and Sanitation Masterplan (PWSSMP), which was eventually launched. This initiative offers crucial opportunities to systematically attain WASH targets under SDG6. Inclusion of WASH in the emergency anticipatory actions pilot offers prospects to try out new approaches. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:23/12/2021

baseline.value: Established (National strategy approved and adopted, but not regularly funded or reviewed); 2019 actual budget: P14m; 2018: Partial data on G1/ZOD only

actual.value: 2021:12 million cash incentive to regions for MILEHS + 2million budget for chlorine granules

title.narrative: Existence of functioning cluster coordination mechanism for water, sanitation and hygiene in humanitarian situations, Text

baseline.value: National level: Initiating (Coordination mechanisms for humanitarian action exists and needs external support to co-lead the sector coordination role); 2018: No national policy on WASH cluster institutionalization at subnational level; 2018: Strategic pla

actual.value: 2021:Initiatingcoordination National policy onWIE disseminated toall Regions Detailed operationalplan for 2021updated, properlycosted, and reviewedat end of year

title.narrative: Existence of functioning sector coordination mechanism for water, sanitation and hygiene , Text

baseline.value: National: Initiating; Subnational: Weak (Gov't led coordination mechanism does not exist at subnational level and needs support to lead, co-lead or provide more than 50% resources); 2018: IACEH TWG existing ('initiating'); RIACEH Reg 8: established; RIACE

target.value: 2023: Established at both national and sub-national level
